title: Public complaints galore over neglected lands buildings
byline: In the wake of the rise of Chikungunya cases in Sri Lanka, in addition to Dengue, Colombo Municipal Council’s (CMC) Public Health Officers are planning for the use of drone technology to identify empty lands and buildings that serve as possible mosquito-breeding grounds, an official said.

title: Govt talks, never walks the talk: Ruwan
byline: The Health Minister and the government remain inactive despite diseases such as Chikungunya and Dengue spreading in the city of Colombo and the rest of the country, UNP Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene said yesterday

title: FBI Special Agent confirms Zahran Hashim as mastermind behind Easter Sunday attacks
byline: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) of the United States, which conducted investigations into serial bombings on Easter Sunday in 2019, has clearly mentioned Zahran Hashim as the mastermind of the attack.

title: Who will be the next pope? Some potential candidates to succeed Francis
byline: A ‘continuity’ pick, the possible first Asian pope or first black pontiff in centuries are among likely contenders

title: National prices continue to ease at 1.9% in March
byline: The national consumer prices continued to fall, albeit at a lesser pace in March, on the back of the decline in food prices as well as the slippage in non-food prices, ahead of the traditional new year.

title: Tourist arrivals reach 846,221 by April 20, nearly 15% rise
byline: Sri Lanka welcomed 846,221 tourists as of April 20 this year, translating to a 14.5 percent year-on-year (YoY) growth, up from 739,171 tourist arrivals recorded during the same period last year.

title: Police dive into 67,000 pages Easter Sunday attack Commission report
byline: Sri Lanka Police have appointed a four-member committee to study the final report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry into the Easter Sunday bomb attacks, which spans approximately 66,000 to 67,000 pages, police said.

title: Clean Sri Lanka urges devotees to avoid polythene at Dalada Maligawa
byline: As thousands of devotees gather at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy during the ’Siri Dalada Dekma’, the Clean Sri Lanka programme has issued an appeal urging visitors to refrain from bringing non-biodegradable items, especially polythene, to the temple premises.

title: Govt eyes marine, inland water transport to boost tourism, urban mobility
byline: In a move aimed at revitalising the country’s tourism industry and easing urban transportation, the government has planned to launch a comprehensive boat service utilising the island’s extensive coastline and inland waterways, Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Easter attack probe underway, no need to panic: Minister
byline: The government is questioning why some former government members, now in the Opposition, appear so worried about the ongoing investigations into the Easter Sunday bomb attacks, Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: New Commissioner General for DMT
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to appoint Kamal Amarasinghe as the new Commissioner General for the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT)

title: Unite to defeat extremism, deliver justice to Easter attack victims: Gnanasara Thera
byline: To genuinely bring justice to those who died and to those permanently disabled in the Easter Sunday bomb attacks, we must unite to defeat the rabid Islamic extremist forces that are spreading like a cancer in this country, Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera said.

title: CID launches probe into fake letter circulating on social media
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation after a fake letter titled ’CONVICTION’, bearing the name and forged signature of Acting IGP Priyantha Weerasuriya, was circulated on social media.

title: AG requests CJ to appoint trial-at-bar in Keheliya’s drug purchase case
byline: The Attorney General has requested the Chief Justice to appoint three High Court judges to constitute a High Court-at-Bar for the trial against former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella over the controversial  purchase of substandard immunoglobulin injections.

title: Deshabandu ordered to appear before Matara magistrate’s court on April 25
byline: Matara Magistrate Aruna Indrajith Buddhadasa has summoned former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon to appear before the court on April 25.

title: Woman arrested for suspicious behaviour near Kochchikade Church released by court
byline: A woman who was taken into custody near the Kochchikade Church due to her suspicious behaviour yesterday has been released after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Pope Francis went beyond his faith: Ranil
byline: Pope Francis’ interests went beyond the faith as he focused on Ukraine and Gaza, poverty, climate change and other instances of injustice, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said in a condolence message on the demise of the Roman Catholic Leader on Monday.

title: Gunman arrested after failed shooting attempt in Katunayake
byline: A suspect was arrested following a failed shooting attempt at Andiambalama in Katunayake this morning, police said.

title: Pope Francis' funeral to be held on Saturday
byline: Pope Francis’ funeral will be held on Saturday, April 26, at 10.00 a.m. (0800 GMT) at St. Peter’s Basilica, the Vatican said in a statement.

title: Australian ex-cricketer Slater sentenced for domestic violence
byline: Former Australia cricketer Michael Slater has been handed a partly suspended four-year prison sentence after pleading guilty to domestic violence charges.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith not among aspirants for papacy
byline: Referring to the reports in the social media that Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith is a contender for the papacy which has fallen vacant with the death of Pope Francis, a spokesman for the Catholic Church in Sri Lanka said there is no such thing called contenders for the papacy.
